artists.name: Solo Works
artists.description: My own solo endevours. From solo live vocal/ guitar performances to full band studio recordings, most of my musical endevours have been solo efforts.

albums.name: Rock Opera
albums.description: A rock opera that I've been working on. I still need better titles for everything... Click here for more info / storyline

songs.name: Farther Away
songs.description:
The intro is set during the not-so-far-distant future in a region of the world that is being hit hard by climate change. The local farmers are struggling to grow their crops, leaving them with little money. Because of this, they have to turn to other means to survive.
Farther Away starts with a mother lamenting about her living conditions. She recently sold her only daughter so that she would have enough money to struggle out a living. It has finally sunk in that she will never get to see her daugter again.
This song is supposed to segue directly into Here We Are, but I just didn't record the demo that way for whatever reason.

songs.name: Here We Are
songs.description: Ah, so here we are. The intro is done and here comes the bulk of Act I. This song introduces the four themes found in this act.

songs.name: Boy
songs.description: We now fast forward a few years and find ourselves in a richer part of the world. Life looks great, families are well fed, well educated, and well entertained. This songs introduces to the protagonist of our story; a Boy in his senior year of highschool. He sings about his issues as he struggles to maintain a relationship.

songs.name: Parents
songs.description: We follow the Boy as he arrives home after school. His father is there waiting for him, upset that he is so late. His father berates him for not working towards finding a career path as the Boy complains that he isn't given enough space. After being chewed out, the Boy overhears his mother questioning how they are raising their child.

songs.name: Friends, The Meeting
songs.description:
This is both song 5 and 6, as they flow directly into one another. The Boy, being banished to his room, complains to his friends while he does his school work. His friends try to pressure him to sneak out late at night to have some fun. The Boy is conflicted, not wanting to disobey even more, but eventually caves in and follows them out.
Fast foward to later that night, the Boy and his friends are up to no good. They wind up at a whore house where his friends ask the Madam to treat him well. The madam takes the Boy to their newest possession, the Girl sold in the first song.
This is the closing song of Act I.

songs.name: Losing, Looking Back
songs.description:
The intro to Act II goes back to the mother of the Girl. Life has not gotten any better after selling her daughter. Their town is in ruins due to recent floods and there is no help in sight.
Looking Back starts off the main part of Act II which is a flashback of what happend to the Girl after she was sold. It introduces the four themes found in Act II.

songs.name: Owner
songs.description: The Girl, recently being sold, is introduced to her new owner. He tells her what her life will now be like, as she as terrified about what is happening.

songs.name: Escape
songs.description: One of the other slaves she lives with attempts to make an escape and pulls the Girl along. She is thrilled about getting away, but at the same time, she is terrified about being caught. The worst happens, and they are caught. The Girl quickly burst out crying that she was forced to go along. The owner lets her off the hook as he big plans for her, but the Girl never sees the other slave again...

songs.name: Dusty Road
songs.description: The new job for the girl is a sex scam. She attracts rich tourists who think they can have it all while her Owner bursts in their room before anything can happen and blackmails them for their money. The Girl is being well treated and fed during all this and her determination to make something out of her life grows.

songs.name: Lost Soul
songs.description: Nothing good lasts for long. The Girl is sold to the whorehouse where the Boy found her. Once again, the Girl's life is throw to tatters and she loses all hope that she will ever have a good life.

songs.name: New Life
songs.description: Flash back over, we are back in the present. After recounting her life to the Boy, she wants to just be left alone. The Boy refuses, wanting to help her out. He realises that he has to do something about this problem and vows to dedicate his life to it.

artists.name: The Cam Jervis Experience
artists.description: For the last year in high school, my friends and I formed a band. I was on lead guitar, and played keys and sang vocals for some tracks. We rocked out at various local venues, benefit concerts and battle of the bands. While we played a couple original songs, we mainly played covers.

albums.name: Songs
albums.description: Originals and covers played by The Cam Jervis Experience

songs.description: Progressive rock song Credits: Lead Guitar: Andrew Russell Rhythm Guitar: Adam Baigent Bass Guitar: Cam Jervis Didgeridoo: Adam Baigent Drums: Garry Garneau Music written by: The Cam Jervis Experience

songs.description: Laid back folk Credits: Lead Vocals: Garry Garneau Backing Vocals: Adam Baigent, Andrew Russell, Cam Jervis Russian Lap Harp: Garry Garneau Guitar: Adam Baigent Piano: Andrew Russell Bass: Cameron Jervis Music written by Adam Baigent Lyrics written by Garry Garneau

artists.name: The Orfs
artists.description: While I was the pianist in the University of Waterloo's Stage Band, the stage band's guitarist invited me to play with his band. The Orfs, a pyscedelic rock band, is led by Grant Kouzechar who writes most of the music we play. The rest of the songs are covers from various artists. I played the keys in this band using a number of sounds ranging from the piano to the organ and even the clavicord.

softwareProjects.name: Personal Website
softwareProjects.description: This is the source for both the server side and client side code required for running this website. Node.js required to run the server.

softwareProjects.name: Defend Your Castle
softwareProjects.description: Lovingly ripped off of the popular flash game. I created this game for a UI assignment at the University of Waterloo. The goal of this game is to kill all of the attacking stick figures by dropping them from a great hight before they knock down your castle.

softwareProjects.name: Soccer Emulator
softwareProjects.description: A soccer emulator I made for as a mini-game for an online, text-based RPG. NOTE: Windows only

softwareProjects.name: Carz
softwareProjects.description: A game I originally saw on a TI-83 graphing calculator.Try to keep your car inside the lines. NOTE: Windows only. Sometimes has framerate issues and runs too fast

softwareProjects.name: Conway's Game of Life
softwareProjects.description: An implementation of Conway's Game of Life using OpenGL

softwareProjects.name: Pong
softwareProjects.description: Pong, teh awesome game. Implemented with C++ and OpenGL. What more can be said? NOTE: Windows only

softwareProjects.name: Hearts
softwareProjects.description: An implementation of hearts I made while learning perl. Needless to say, I have not used perl since.

workProjects.name: Synthesis Engine Prototype
workProjects.description: Prototype of the new concept synthesis engine spec, with a focus on performance.

workProjects.name: Label-to-Concept Engine Prototype
workProjects.description: Prototype of the new label-to-concept engine spec, with a focus on result quality.

workProjects.name: Content Scoring Engine Prototype
workProjects.description: Prototype of the new content scoring engine spec, with a focus on a smoother range of content scores.

workProjects.name: Virtual Surround Sound Driver
workProjects.description: Driver that takes stereo input audio and outputs 5.1 virtual surround sound.

workProjects.name: Accessibility API
workProjects.description: Accessibility features for a public API that enable blind and low vision users to consume applicaitons written with the API.

workProjects.name: Internal Native Client Demo
workProjects.description: Native client application used for demo certain native client capabilities.

workProjects.name: Speech Enabled Text Adventure
workProjects.description: Browser extension that allows speech to text input and text to speech output for text adventure games based on the Parchment engine.

workProjects.name: Internal TouchUI Demo
workProjects.description: Clone of an existing internal demo as a web application using TouchUI

workProjects.name: TouchUI
workProjects.description: Library to help create Web Applications that mimick native applications for mobile devices.

workProjects.name: Audio Driver Emulator
workProjects.description: Implemented an audio driver for the Symbian OS emulator on Windows for a specific line of smartphones.

workProjects.name: Issue Tracking System
workProjects.description: New web front end for the internal work item tracking system.

workProjects.name: ASReml Batch
workProjects.description: Tool for running large number of ASReml calculations and for running further statistical calculations over the results.

schoolProjects.name: Second Screen
schoolProjects.description: Automatic meeting transcription tool, recognizing both who is speaking and what is being said.

schoolProjects.name: Introduction to Computer Graphics
schoolProjects.description: OpenGL application featuring flocking, L-System plants, terrain erosion and water rippling systems.

schoolProjects.name: Computational Vision
schoolProjects.description: Panoramic stitching program that takes arbitrary images and recognizes both if and how they are connected, and then composes the connected images.

schoolProjects.name: Operating Systems
schoolProjects.description: Simple, real-time operating system implemented for a Motorola 68k series chip.
